title: Phase 3: Frontend Implementation
description:
Build the React SPA frontend per ADR-004 (amended), ADR-008, ADR-009, ADR-010, ADR-011.

Architecture: Three packages (@lumehaven/core, @lumehaven/react, reference dashboard). BFF pattern: frontend talks only to our backend via enriched Signal API (typed value, display_value, available, signal_type). Published to GitHub Packages. Personal dashboards in separate repos.

Sequencing: Backend Signal enrichment (ADR-010) → Frontend scaffolding → Core + React packages → Reference dashboard.

Target: Raspberry Pi 4 (low browser workload). Soft perf targets: <2s initial load, <100ms SSE-to-render.

title: Revisit ADR-004 (Frontend Stack) and ADR-001 (State Management)
description: Before starting frontend implementation, reevaluate the architectural decisions from Phase 0. ADR-004 chose React+Vite+TS+bun, ADR-001 chose in-memory state. Verify these still fit after backend maturity phase learnings. This task BLOCKS all other Phase 3 work — no implementation before the architecture is confirmed or updated.
close_reason: Completed: Full architectural assessment done. Created ADR-008 (Frontend Package Architecture), ADR-009 (Dashboard Ownership), ADR-010 (Signal Model Enrichment), ADR-011 (Command Architecture). Amended ADR-004 and ADR-005. ADR-001 confirmed unchanged. All architectural drivers resolved.

description: Initial test setup with Vitest. Smoke tests for app rendering and basic component behavior.

title: Refine test strategy for frontend (ADR-006)
description: Extend ADR-006 testing strategy to cover frontend-specific concerns: component testing, E2E boundaries, mocking strategies.

title: Implement Signal model enrichment (ADR-010)
description:
Implement the enriched Signal model from ADR-010. Changes:
1. Add SignalType StrEnum to core/signal.py (STRING, NUMBER, BOOLEAN, ENUM, DATETIME)
2. Widen Signal.value to str|int|float|bool|None
3. Add display_value:str, available:bool, signal_type:SignalType fields
4. Deprecate is_undefined() helper (use signal.available instead)
5. Update Signal.to_dict() / from_dict() for new fields
6. Update SignalResponse pydantic model in api/routes.py
7. Update SSE event format in api/sse.py
8. Update all existing unit and integration tests

This BLOCKS all frontend work — the API contract must be stable before building the frontend.
close_reason: Implemented Signal model enrichment per ADR-010: SignalType StrEnum, widened value type, added display_value/available/signal_type fields, updated to_dict/from_dict, SignalResponse, test fixtures, and all unit tests. Also fixed pydantic-settings extra=ignore for env var tolerance.

title: Update OpenHAB adapter for enriched Signal model
description:
Update the OpenHAB adapter to produce enriched Signals per ADR-010:
1. Set signal_type based on OpenHAB item types (Number→NUMBER, Switch→BOOLEAN, String→STRING, DateTime→DATETIME, etc.)
2. Set typed value (float for numbers, bool for switches, str for strings, None for UNDEF/NULL)
3. Set display_value as the pre-formatted string (existing formatting logic)
4. Set available=False for UNDEF/NULL states, True otherwise
5. Handle enum-like states (ON/OFF→bool, UP/DOWN→bool) per ADR-010 mapping rules
6. Update all adapter unit tests and integration test fixtures

title: Add send_command() to adapter protocol (ADR-011)
description:
Extend SmartHomeAdapter protocol with send_command() method per ADR-011:
1. Add send_command(signal_id: str, command: str) -> None to protocol.py
2. Add SignalNotFoundError to exceptions.py if not present
3. Design (but don't implement) the REST endpoint: POST /api/signals/{signal_id}/command
4. Add CommandRequest pydantic model
5. Update protocol documentation and docstrings
Implementation of the actual endpoint and OpenHAB adapter command support deferred to interactive widget phase.

close_reason: Resolved: T6 gate task completed. Decision: full enrichment — typed value, display_value, available flag, signal_type discriminator. Documented in ADR-010. TODO T6 marked resolved.

title: Scaffold frontend packages (core, react, frontend) with bun workspaces
description:
Scaffold all three frontend packages per ADR-008 and ADR-009:
1. packages/core/ — @lumehaven/core (vanilla TypeScript, zero React dependency)
   - bun init, tsconfig.json, package.json
   - src/ structure: client.ts, store.ts, commands.ts, types.ts, visibility.ts
2. packages/react/ — @lumehaven/react (React bindings, peerDep on react)
   - bun init, tsconfig.json, package.json (depends on @lumehaven/core)
   - src/ structure: provider.tsx, hooks.ts, Signal.tsx
3. packages/frontend/ — Reference dashboard application
   - bun create vite with React+TS template
   - workspace deps on @lumehaven/core and @lumehaven/react
4. Configure bun workspaces in root package.json
5. Set up TypeScript project references across packages

title: Reference dashboard app shell with Vite + React + routing
description:
Set up the reference dashboard application in packages/frontend/ per ADR-009:
1. React + Vite + TypeScript configuration (Vite dev server, build pipeline)
2. App shell with SignalProvider from @lumehaven/react
3. Client-side routing setup for device-specific layouts (/, /mobile, /kiosk)
4. Plain CSS + BEM base styles for the reference dashboard
5. Zustand store for UI state (theme, active dashboard view)
6. Connection status banner component (error UX per ADR-004 amendment)
This is the reference dashboard that serves as documentation, test fixture, and development workspace.

title: SignalClient (core) + React hooks (useSignal, useSignals)
description:
Implement the framework-agnostic signal client in @lumehaven/core per ADR-008:
1. SignalClient class: SSE connection to backend, reconnection with backoff, heartbeat detection
2. SignalStore class: in-memory Map of enriched Signal objects, subscribe(id)/subscribeAll() with notification
3. Signal TypeScript interfaces matching ADR-010 enriched model (typed value, display_value, available, signal_type)
4. Connection state management (connected/disconnecting/reconnecting)
Then implement React bindings in @lumehaven/react:
5. SignalProvider (React Context wrapping SignalClient)
6. useSignal(id) hook — returns single signal, re-renders on update
7. useSignals() hook — returns all signals (the 'items' pattern from PoC)
8. Connection status hook for the status banner

title: Reference dashboard layout (responsive, device routing)
description:
Reference dashboard layout in packages/frontend/ per ADR-008/009:
1. Grid/flex-based responsive layout with device-specific CSS
2. Header/topbar component (signal status indicators)
3. Main content area with panel routing
4. Tablet layout (default /) and mobile layout (/mobile)
5. BEM CSS with dashboard-level overrides demonstrating the pattern
Target: Raspberry Pi 4 display with soft performance targets (<2s load, <100ms SSE-to-render).

title: Signal display component (<Signal>) with BEM + data attributes
description:
Implement the <Signal> display component in @lumehaven/react per ADR-008:
1. Signal component with both syntaxes: <Signal id='...' /> and <Signal signal={...} />
2. DOM structure: wrapper span.signal with data-available, data-type, data-id attributes
3. BEM naming: .signal__value for display_value, .signal__unit for unit
4. Auto-hide when !available (via data-available attribute + CSS)
5. Base CSS file with BEM styles (plain CSS, no modules/tailwind)
6. Unit tests with React Testing Library

title: plan:ui drill-down: interactive task view within epics
description:
Enhance plan:ui (plan-interactive.sh) to support two-level navigation:

1. **Epic view** (existing) — fzf list of epics with progress bars and preview
2. **Task view** (new) — when Enter is pressed on an epic, replace the epic list with an fzf list of that epic's tasks. Preview shows task description. Enter shows full task details.
3. **Back navigation** — pressing Esc (or a dedicated key) in the task view returns to the epic view.

This replaces the current behavior where Enter dumps `bd children` output and exits.
